--- Azafroth / Ikoto ---

Azafroth and the other Ikoto flash their approval. "Good good," 
thinks Azafroth globally, "We shall choose a group of bots from 
Cybertron who're being sent on a secret mission which we forged 
and they fell for. They will... disappear, only to find themselves 
crashing towards earth. Once they arrive, they will begin, 
unknowingly, to wage a war for the destruction of the very planet 
that they wish to help!" as Azafroth finishes his speech, he and the 
other Ikoto are visibly shimmering with malevolent excitement. 
"You will hear from us soon." Azafroth stops shimmering, "Until we 
meet again, Vok representative." With a small wave of energy is 
thrown from the Ikoto as they teleport. a faint telepathik message 
drifts on the wave, "Untilllll weee meeettt aggaiinnnn, Vokkkkk."



On 15 May 2001, at 15:24, Yanshosh@... wrote:

> ::The Vok::
> 
> The Vok let out an annoyed thought at the interference of the second
> Ikoto, but that was how life was. The Ikoto were a nuissance to it,
> though it had to admit that their offer was fairly interesting.
> 
> "Hmm..." it told them while it considered the offer, "Time must stay
> intact, but I must discuss this with another."
> 
> The Vok looks past the Ikoto as another golden head floats into view.
> The two Vok have a short mental conference, the second leaving when
> they were done, though it glances over the Ikoto with contempt in its
> thoughts before it departs.
> 
> "Very well," the remaining Vok replies, "We accept your bet. My group
> is ready on the planet."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> > --- Ikoto / Azafroth / Brodak / Uokarase ---
> > 
> > Azafroth's thoughts again drift along the nebular dust patterns. 
> "I'm 
> > am pleased that you are interested. Let me begin." His translucent
> > corporal body begins to shimmer as he recounts what he and the other
> > Ikoto had said. "We, the Ikoto, would like to propose a bet, 
> or 
> > gamble you could say, on the fate of that planet, Earth. We 
> > propose that the Ikoto chose a group of sentient beings, like the
> > ones you already have messed with, and put them on the planet. There
> > they will be empowered with tasks, tasks of utmost importance in
> > their minds. The group that the Ikoto choose will have to defeat
> > your group, and gain control of the planet. Likewise, your chosen
> > ones will have to defeat the bots chosen by the Ikoto. If our side
> > succeeds, we will do what we will with the planet," continued
> > Azafroth knowing full well that the Vok knew what the Ikoto would
> > do, "and if your side succeeds, then we will leave." The Ikoto's
> > body shimmers in cruel delight at the game, knowing that their
> > choice of chosen robots was the ultimate irony. Azafroth emanated a
> > cold amused smile. Uokarase buts into the telepathik war zone, and
> > put mental pressure on the Vok representative, "Well, what do you
> > say?" Uokarase's thoughts speed intently around the groups.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > On 15 May 2001, at 6:07, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > 
> > > ::The Vok::
> > > 
> > > If Voks frowned, this one would have. It had been doing an 
> important
> > > job, keeping track of time, and these Ikoto came along with a 
> probably
> > > silly proposal and waste its time. But it supposed that watching 
> the
> > > planet was fairly boring. Personally, it didn't like the Ikoto, 
> but it
> > > had to deal with them.
> > > 
> > > "Very well, speak," it finally informed them, "I will listen, but 
> do
> > > not waste my time. I have an important duty to fulfil."
> 
>
